Award.AbstractNarration:
This awards provides funding to help defray the expenses of participants in the conference "West Coast Operator Algebra Seminar 2014" that will be held November 1-2, 2014, on the campus of the University of Denver.

This conference is the twenty-second installment of the West Coast Operator Algebra Seminar (WCOAS), a series that annually brings together a diverse group of mathematicians whose primary research interests are in various facets of the theory of operator algebras. A sampling of the topical foci of the 2014 event is given by the following: the Elliott program for the classification of C*-algebras; applications of operator algebras to mathematical physics; noncommutative geometry; the Baum-Connes conjecture; free probability and its applications; subfactors and their invariants. The conference program provides ample opportunity for graduate students, postdocs, and other young scientists to present their work.

POR.DRECONTENT:
Timely dissemination of cutting edge research is fundamental to the health of the research community, and conferences provide the natural mean to achieve this goal. The West Coast Operator Algebra Seminar is a yearly, recurrent conference in the subfield of functional analysis dedicated to the study of the objects which arise from quantum mechanics and have since played a role in other branches of mathematics, such as geometry of singular spaces.  In 2014, this conference was organized by Dr. Latremoliere, at the University of Denver. With the University of Denver carrying the financial burden of the organization of this conference, this grant provided the financial support for attendees and speakers, needed to ensure that fiducial considerations would not contrain the choice of speakers nor prevent any specialist of the field, especially amoung junior  mathematicians, to attend. Thanks to these funds, many junior mathematicians and many mathematicians from underrepresented groups were able to either give presentations or attend this important yearly conference, with all the benefits implied.

The slides of the presentations given during this conference are archived at:

http://www.cs.du.edu/~frederic/wcoas2014/index.php

Presentations included applications of research in operator  algebra theory to quantum physics, to group theory, to graph theory, and many other topics.
